chargeHist.descr: Impersonating a Peace Officer to Aid in Commission of Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie M. Sledzik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • False Swearing-Government Setting, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent on Cts 1 & 4 and with Ct. 3 of 14CF1223.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be part time employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (Unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $400  plus surcharges.  
May not have contact with in any way with Michael or Roxanne M or their son or family, Ivanhoe's - it's owners or employees, Carthage staff, UW Parkside Campus, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim R.M. present.  Statement from Susan S.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 4 and with ct 3 of 14CF1223; 12 months conditional jail is stayed on each ct; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $400 (by stipulation of deft); bond applied to restitution/costs in this file and to costs in file 14CF1223, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; P&P to begin assessment while deft is still confined; credit for 20 days served if revoked.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 5 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 4.  PSI ordered.  SEH 2/4/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/J. Thwing   Victims present.  DE requests more time to consider offer.  FPT adjourned to 12-17-14 at 8:45am.  Bond continues.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victims present.  ADA Phan states she just provided an offer.  FPT continued to 12/2/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John German. Clerk LE. Case trails 14CF1223. Judicial pretrial on 11-13-14 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
With Atty German the FPT of 10/23/14 at 8:30am is cancelled and case is set over to be heard w/14CF1223 in intake court on 10/29/14 at 9:30am.
Consent and order for substitution of counsel; Atty J German is substituted as counsel in place of Atty W Michel II.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
